guide.title: Troubleshooting Apache
guide.abstract: This document covers a number of ways to figure out how to fix your Apache installation when things are working correctly.

body.p: We hope to cover some of the most common problems with Apache and it's modules, and how to fix them here. If you have an issue that isn't covered here, see the Getting help section.

section.title: Apache is returning zero-length pages or segfaulting

body.p: This usually happens after an upgrade, usually because binary compatibility broke in APR (which may happen for a number for reasons). To fix this, you need to rebuild the Apache tool stack:
body.pre:
(make sure you do these in order, it's very important!)
(first, we have to remove the currently installed apache) # emerge -aCv '=net-www/apache-2*'
(then we rebuild the tool stack) # emerge -av '=dev-libs/apr-0*' '=dev-libs/apr-util-0*'
(then we reinstall apache) # emerge -av '=net-www/apache-2*'
(determine any packages that depend on apache) $ equery depends net-www/apache [ Searching for packages depending on net-www/apache... ] dev-php/phpsysinfo-2.3-r2 dev-php/phpsysinfo-2.1-r2 dev-php/mod_php-4.3.11-r2 net-www/mod_layout-4.0.1a-r1 www-servers/gorg-0.5
(then rebuild any modules you have installed) # emerge -av '=dev-php/mod_php-4.3.11-r2' '=net-www/mod_layout-4.0.1.a-r1'
body.p: You should now have a working Apache installation. If you don't see the Getting Help section.
If none of the above was any use to you, or if you have other questions, feel free to stop by our IRC channel, #gentoo-apache on irc.freenode.net. Or you may also file a bug on Gentoo's Bugzilla.
